Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views...”
Reviews.Author: Jill-Een
Reviews.Content: ...if it's clear in Vancouver. We had a north facing room which looked out over the city, the mountains and the water. So nice! It didnt have as much of a "Club Intrawest" feeling (like the "Club" feeling specifically) as we've experienced at other Club locations but it was beautiful. Great down town location within walking distance of all venues including Gastown (perhaps not so much in the rain!). Also didnt notice any free perks like snacks and coffee as I've seen in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Room With a View...”
Reviews.Author: TamandTomAlberta
Reviews.Content: Month of Stay: December Room: 1 Bedroom/2 Bathroom The room was very clean and comfortable. My husband and I especially LOVED the view. The windows are literally from the ceiling to the floor in the bedroom and the living room area--SPECTACULAR!!! The view of the city is amazing from the 30th floor of the Sheraton Wall Center. Internet: Free internet service in our room. Parking: This is where it can get COSTLY! Keep in mind, you are in downtown Vancouver and parking is expensive to begin with. The price is from $28.46-31.30/night (OUCH!!!). Front Desk Staff: Lovely, lovely, lovely.... We were served by various individuals and the service was always good. Location: Right in the heart of Vancouver and walking distance to a lot of great shopping and restaurants. Overall, my husband and I loved our stay at the Vancouver Club Intrawest property. We will definitely be back in the future. Just remember to factor in the price of parking into the overall expense of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: chrnic25
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Intrawest Wall Centre and had a very good experience. We choose this hotel in part because our friends were staying across the street at a Windmark timeshare but it was withing walking distance of many attractions and stores. We had a studio room which provided ample space for 2 people, there was a very large closet, large bathroom, a small kitchenette and wall to ceiling windows which provided amazing views. The only negatives were the $28/night parking fee which did include in and out privileges and there was a repair done to the bathroom ceiling which was not finished properly and made the bathroom feel a bit shabby. Overall I would not hesitant to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for comfortable room in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy neighbours distract from an otherwise great stay”
Reviews.Author: cmbtraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Intrawest Wall Centre previously and generally it was very good. Our most recent visit was very stressful and disappointing. The people staying above us (concrete building!!!) were extremely noisy. Loud music, up late partying at night, dragging their furniture across the floor at all hours of the day and banging on 'Godfrey only knows what' but like we were inside a drum sometimes. We mentioned the problem to the on duty concierge as well as the reception but nothing was done to deal with the situation over the 4 nights that we were there. Other than that it would have been great as it has generally been in the past. In general Club Intrawest people are very respectful and considerate but I've heard they now allow the Sheraton to rent Club Intrawest rooms to the general public.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views and location - ideal for short stays”
Reviews.Author: OttawaAli
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Club Intrawest in May for 1 night and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. Club Intrawest uses the top floors of the Sheraton Vancouver Wall Centre tower and guests are able to use all of the Sheraton's facilities. The location is excellent, within walking distance of many of the major attractions. I had a queen bed room, which had a small kitchenette as well as a seating area with table. The room was a good size and had a huge bathroom, with walk in shower. Being on the top floors of the tower the rooms have magnificent views, especially with the floor to ceiling windows. The room was clean, very comfortable and felt modern (although note for longer stays cleaning isn't done every day). Check-in and check-out was all through the Sheraton hotel staff who were polite and friendly. Given I checked in late and left relatively early I didn't use the Club Intrawest area (which is a lounge area with tea/coffee/snacks/newspapers and PCs available). There is a conceierge on duty during the day who can help with reservations and other bookings. Club Intrawest also gives discounts on some of the Sheraton's paid for facilities such as spa treatments. The gym and swimming pool area are excellent, the pool was a nice size and there are changing facilities there to use. Be aware the gym can get busy though. If you can find a cheap deal for Club Intrawest then I definitely recommend it, especially if your only planning on staying a few nights. However at full price I'm not sure if it's worth it, there's bigger rooms in hotels close by. Bad points - Can be pricey. Good points - Excellent location for downtown. Fantastic views and a really comfy room. Free Wi-fi. Club Intrawest facilities useful especially for those with busy schedules. Tips - The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Skytrain (Vancouver City Centre or Yaletown - both on the Canada line which links direct to the airport). There's a small notice-board outside the Club Intrawest lounge where people put up their hints and tips for Vancouver's best restaurants and activities, well worth a read.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning views and apartment”
Reviews.Author: Starkraving
Reviews.Content: Club Intrawest is based on the top 3 floors of the north tower of the Sheraton Wall Centre. There is a 24 reception in both towers. We had a 1 bedroom suite for 3 of us. The room was very comfortable, very modern, and had spectacular views of the city (Robson Square). The service by the staff was excellent. The hotel is based halfway down Burrard street so is within 10 minutes walk of False Creek (Granville Island), and Coal Harbour/Gastown. It is closer to the centre of the shopping and entertainment districts. Yaletown, with it's excellent bars and restaurants is an easy 10 minute stroll as well. It's a bit far to walk to the nearest Skytrain station (Yaletown Roundhouse) with suitcases. We caught a taxi from the airport ($42) and then on the way back to the airport we got a taxi to Yaletown Roundhouse station ($5) and caught the train from there. We arrived at the hotel around 11am. The room wasn't ready (as expected), but the hotel stored our cases and issued us with receipts for them. The rooms came with complimentary wireless internet (nice as other hotels charge around $15 per day) We had a very nice stay there and would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Benzo3322
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio room, which was ample for two adults. Our room had a view of mountains, city & water and was a constant source of amazement each day we walked into it. The sunsets were spectacular! Floor to ceiling windows, with a tripod-mounted telescope in each room. The kitchenette was fine for breakfast and the occasional reheated leftovers for lunch, and included a microwave, coffee maker, sink and mini-fridge. Club Intrawest is housed in the Sheraton Wall Centre, and is literally steps from every convenience one could imagine. The city is VERY walkable: we only took public transportation to reach the outer districts (Granville Is./South Vancouver & Grouse Mountain/North Vancouver). Other than that, we walked everywhere, including Stanley Park, Gastown, Chinatown, Yaletown, etc. Staff was extremely helpful with check-in, restaurant recommendations, etc. The health club was certainly adequate, but felt somehow as if it was an afterthought in design. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Week in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: signora2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week spent in Vancouver, using an exchange into Intrawest Timeshares located in the Sheraton Wall Center hotel in downtown. As for our experience, we were very pleased with this exchange. The Facility: Located on the top three floors of the Sheraton Wall Center hotel, we received our confirmation for a studio room that we knew would be very compact. So we were very pleasantly surprised to find we had been upgraded to a one bedroom suite on the 29th floor. We were very happy with the room. The living space consisted of an ample room equipped with a couch that sat 2 comfortably, and an easy chair. In the center of the room was an island with two bar stools for eating. Contained within the island was the flat screen TV and the refrigerator and some drawers. On the far wall was the sink, microwave and coffee maker. In the closet in this room was the ironing board and iron, a room safe, a recycle bin and a flashlight. The bathroom had a long double sink, and a bath tub with shower capability and a private commode. The bedroom had a queen sized very comfortable bed, nightstands and a closet. The best thing about the suite was the full outer wall of floor to ceiling glass windows that looked out on the city. While we did not have a mountain or harbor view, we didn’t complain since we had the upgrade!! The only downside to the room was the lighting. The only light in the bedroom were two very small lights on the nightstands that did not reflect into the entire room, so once the sun set, the bedroom was not easy to navigate in. Phones in livingroom and bedroom. Local and 800 calls free. Wifi available in room at no cost. Passwords on the welcome information located in the room. There was a community lounge on the 29th floor that had an Interwest concierge present for a few hours in the morning and the afternoon. Newpapers, coffee, restaurant menus, maps, a computer with printer and a telescope were available for use there. We could also use the hotel concierge in the main lobby. The hotel was very quiet. Even though they had a convention occurring while we were there, we heard no noise and had no problems using the elevator. The hotel was conveniently located on the corner of Hornby and Burrard. The bus stop on Burrard was very convenient. We used only local transportation and had no problems at all. Since this is not a primary timeshare location, Intrawest did not have any events planned for quests, so do not expect an orientation, a welcome event, or any timeshare presentation offers. The Location: We found the location perfect for an urban stay in Vancouver. We arrived at the international terminal of Vancouver airport and took the Skytrain to the Hotel. Skytrain was located at the junction of the International and domestic terminals on the arrivals floor. We went to the lower level near the Skytrain entrance where a 7/11 sold books of 10 Translink tickets. This allowed us to avoid the $5 airport surcharge for any ticket purchased at the Skytrain machine. We took the Skytrain to the Vancouver Center station and then walked the blocks to the hotel. For our entire stay we only used public transportation, using Translink tickets. One day, when we had a number of sites to see, we purchased a Day Pass for the day and it was easy to jump on and off buses. The hotel pointed us to the AIG market two blocks away for groceries. Be prepared for sticker shock. Vancouver has the highest cost of living of any city in Canada. Tax is 12%. VERY expensive to shop here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: respbill020
Reviews.Content: We stayed based on reviews on this site and were not disappointed. The hotel is very good for downtown as you can walk to shopping and restaurants. The water taxi to Granville Island is also a short walk away. The club has separate keys for the floors. We stayed in a studio and it had a kitchen which was nice for eating breakfast and the bathroom, with a big walk in shower, was large. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows with great views of the city however since it is a timeshare, the rooms are cleaned every 4th day unless you pay extra. Getting extra towels or coffee packs was not a problem, we just asked. Small IGA grocery close by and lots of places to eat. We didn't use the parking or pool. Staff was helpful with storing our bags, getting us a key early to the concierge room at the club and also on booking tours. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it seemed”
Reviews.Author: Altezza
Reviews.Content: Perhaps it was my expectation and all the advertisment that showed how great this location was but here are what I had noticed: Hot tub problems (one not working and other is always on and off) Steamroom shut-down (due to health concerns) Spa/Fitness staff - not friendly especially knowing that we were time-share guests Heating system in room - noisy and short cycling (turning heater on and off constantly even setting the temp at 20 degree Bed mattress was worned out Old TV and poor cable reception

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price - just all around good choice”
Reviews.Author: SarahChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I found out about Club Intrawest through Tripadvisor so I wanted to make sure and put in my review. The downtown location is a good one as there are restaurants, shopping and transit all within walking distance. The rooms size was fine for a large metropolitan area. We loved that we had a toaster, dishes, sink, fridge and coffee maker in our room. We stopped by the Marketplace IGA nearby for bagels, bananas, water and ate breakfast in our room during our stay to save a little money. The staff was very polite. I think it was a great deal for the money spent. We were completely satisfied with our stay at the Club Intrawest.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: marios90
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Club Intrawest for 3 nights. The room was large with a kitchenette and a big walk in shower, with separate bathroom. Our room was on the 29th floor and the there is only glass, ceiling to floor and the views were incredible! The staff are very friendly and there is a bar in the lobby and restaurant. Location wise its right in the middle of downtown, so access to any area is only minutes away. Would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: Glitch58
Reviews.Content: I booked the suite after reading reviews here on Tripadvisor, and can honestly say that the whole experience was superb. Not being a member of the Timeshare associated with this property, I could only book a three-day stay out of the week we were in Vancouver, and even though the rest of my stay was just down Hornby St. at another high-rise, I wished we could have stayed here the entire time. The suite is small, but very comfortable, affording excellent views of the city ( we faced the harbor ) and well appointed. Included was a small kitchenette area, a nicely designed (shower only) bathroom, and a small desk area, in addition to the bed area. The kitchenette had all we needed, right down to a wine cork opener, and as an added bonus, free wireless access with the supplied Intrawest password was provided. All of the amenities of the Sheraton were at our disposal: pool, sauna, exercise room, desk services and luggage storage, and during the day, Intrawest had onsite concierges to guide and advise. For those that expect daily housekeeping, Intrawest does not provide service but once a week, but then when I travel, I usually don't use daily linen sevices, so it was not a concern. The hotel itself is very centrally located, about five minutes from Robson Street, and within easy walking distance of the harbor, Gastown, Chinatown, Yaletown, and Stanley Park... bus and cab service is also easily available. For food, there was a small IGA supermarket about two blocks up Burrard Street toward the harbor, and coffee shops bordered on the absurd, but the little French cafe on the Hornby Street corner proved to be the best. And for beer lovers, the Yaletown Brewing Company has some of the best beer and ales I've had anywhere. My advice is, if you can, book it.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give IntraWest Vancouver a "6 out of 5" stars rating”
Reviews.Author: ken240
Reviews.Content: A friend booked this hotel for us, excellent choice!!! We stayed on 29th floor with exceptional view of the harbor, snow mountain, downtown and much more. A telescope is provided in case there is something else you want to take a look at. I read some of the reviews, all the good things are true....You can't beat the location and you can't beat the view. My pictures tell it all, take a look. Will I go back? Yes, absolutely. You need to check in/out at the Sheraton Tower, not downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Sweeping views of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: jnjmooreca
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Club Intrawest (I read about it on TripAdvisor, of course) and I was thoroughly impressed. This Intrawest is located in the heart of Vancouver and is atop the Sheraton towers. I think they are normally time-share apartments so you get a bit more room and apartment-type amenities than a simple hotel room, which is very nice—especially if you’re there for a few days and want to bring in your own food & beverages. It also allows you to have visitors in a common room with its own restroom while keeping the bedroom separated. The room was appointed nicely with modern furniture, art and fixtures. And the view from the room I was in was amazing (room 3052).

Reviews.Title: “Great view from the 28th floor”
Reviews.Author: babygoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week on a timeshare exchange with RCI at the Club Intrawest. The hotel has one of the best locations in the downtown area being in the Sheraton Wall Centre Hotel. It is on floors 28-30 in the north tower of the Sheraton. Club Intrawest guests have all privileges of the Sheraton such as room service, maid service (a $40 per fee for additional service other than the mid-week cleaning if you are a timeshare guest), in room wifi (free for Intrawest guests, just get the password), daily local newspaper delivered to your door each morning, hotel restaurants, Starbucks in the lobby, spa, gym, pool, availability of taxis, tours, etc. Starwood Preferred Guest members can have them input your member number so you can get points on any hotel charges such as meals. The CI lounge on the 29th floor (limited hours) has a computer, newspapers and tourist info, restaurant menus and a staff concierge. You can also use the services of the Sheraton concierge. We were in the smallest size unit, a studio apartment (room 2855) with a kitchenette. In the entry way is a closet with a small safe and a recycle bin. The kitchen area is in the entry hall along one wall with a granite counter, microwave, sink, bar size fridge, stainless thermal pot coffee maker, electric tea kettle, toaster and a two person supply of dishes, cups, glasses, wine glasses, flatware and a cutlery set. The studio units have a small seating area with one chair, a tiny bistro table and two dining chairs. The room has a birds-eye view of the city from the floor to ceiling windows. My only complaint about the unit is that the living area only had the one comfortable chair. The queen size bed is to one side of the room and was very comfortable with good reading lamps and end tables with drawers. The TV is situated to this side of the room in an armoire that has several large storage drawers. The chaise at the end of the bed also had two large drawers. There is a CD player but no DVD. The bathroom was good sized for such a small unit with a granite counter, single sink, large walk-in shower, and toilet in a private closet. There was a hair dryer and some nice smelling bath products. The central downtown location means that most major sights (including the wonderful Stanley Park) are within walking distance. You can also walk a few blocks to the small ferry dock to get to Granville Island. We loved the city of Vancouver, the great restaurants, Stanley Park and the market at Granville Island and would gladly return to the Club Intrawest (or the Sheraton) due to the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to end a trip”
Reviews.Author: teocdl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our last day of a 2-week tour of the area. Our room was a studio on the 28th floor and had awesome views through the floor to ceiling glass located along one wall. Great sunset too. Good location (North tower of the Sheraton Center) and a easy walk to Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: globalitch
Reviews.Content: We were on the 28th floor in a studio room. The room was clean and commanded great views of the city and the mountains. The hotel is centrally located with everything a short walk away. Davis St, Robson St, Yaletown, ferry to Granville Island and other attractions are typically within a 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Best view in Vancouver plus luxury”
Reviews.Author: Grisgrisca
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel for outstanding quality in a high end building and absolutely a fantastic view. A little known secret that despite not having all the amenities of a regular hotel the CLub Intrawest is right across the courtyard and connected to the deluxe Sheraton and in the centre of the Vancouver shopping and eating area all in easy walking distance. But it is the room with a large entrance foyer in marble, a huge bath with separate toilet room and a large walk-in marble shower plus a fully equiped kitchenette area off the foyer with marble top counter and microwave..wonderful. The view is incredible and each room comes equiped with a mounted telescope!! floor to ceiling windows at the top of the world ...I was on floor 37. The bed was extremely luxurious and comfortable..to lie there and look out across the city to the Pacific and the Rocky Mountains..unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “amazing views”
Reviews.Author: cats11
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 week tour of Canada. This was the first hotel of the trip, and what a start! The club is located within the Sheraton Wall centre, and has the use of all the Sheratons facilities. The room was a studio, recently fitted and modern in style. One wall was a floor to ceiling window, 30 floors up and looking out onto the mountains and sea as well as down to the streets of Vancouver. You get a telescope in the room so the views can be taken in. The bathroom was fantastic, and the kitchenette adequate for a snack and breakfast. The main shopping area is a 5 minute walk away, there is a supermarket 2 minutes away and a starbucks in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “A fine place for a pre-ski stopover”
Reviews.Author: DonnieDarker
Reviews.Content: We went skiing in Whistler and wanted to see some of Vancouver before we went. Intrawest (who pretty much own Whistler) were quick to recommend the Club in Vancouver for obvious reasons...they own it too. So, if arranging your ski-trip through intrawest its very convenient. The pros: terrific location. magnificent jaw-dropping views from the floor-to-ceiling windows superficially stylish bathroom and furnishings slots in very conveniently if you are on way to or fro Whistler the building looks extremely cool - quite fun to take a photo outside and show to friends ("we stayed there") The cons: despite warning them in advance it was our honeymoon we got nothing (no champagne, wine, chocolates, upgrade) the safe in our room was broken you don not get 24hr concierge services, although the guy we dealt with who is there for 4 hours a day was extremely helpful the rooms "look" very nice but they have saved a bit of money in terms of quality finish - for example the fan from the bathroom was pretty noisy and you could hear other apartments when they used their showers etc. One of the sockets was broken in our room. Generally the rooms seem a little neglected but not enough to put me off. In summary, I would recommend staying here if it being used a bolt-hole on your way to Whistler. If your entire holiday is being spent in Vancouver then I would have reservations that you might find things to be dissapointed about. If you require a fonrt desk for lots of services then dont bother. On the other hand, if you are failry self-reliant and want somewhere romantic with amazing views for a couple of nights, in a good location then go for it. For 2 nights it suited us very well and the critiscisms I listed above were overlooked because it wasnt the focus of our holiday...we simply en route to Whistler.

Reviews.Title: “I should have known better...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In retrospect, the warning signs of inadequate management and poor service were there even as I researched this property. Finding a phone number for the Vancouver Intrawest was difficult. Having someone answer the phone proved impossible. I was later to learn that the "concierge", apparently the only staff member on site, leaves at 5pm (Intrawest leases 3 floors from the Sheraton. Sheraton staff do the check-in, but can't answer any questions about Intrawest rooms). I finally found a number for the Intrawest "24-hour concierge" in Whistler, who confirmed that a studio can sleep 4 (a queen bed and a pull-out couch). Upon arrival, after a lengthy wait while our room was being finished (check in is at 4:00, but our room wasn't ready until 4:30), we were shocked to see that our studio only had a queen bed. It did not even have a couch, let alone any potential for sleeping 4. Luckily the concierge was still on duty but he offered little in the way of apology and handled the situation poorly. He expressed disbelief that anyone at Intrawest had told me a studio would have a pull-out couch and couldn't believe that we had been allowed to book 4 people into a studio (our travelocity itinerary clearly showed our reservation for 2 adults and 2 kids in a studio). All he could do was move us into a new room at the Sheraton, at a higher rate. What we saw of the room was lovely, but given the inadequate staffing and management of this site, I would not risk booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Matty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid December 2004. Exceptional rooms, Fantastic views, a short walk to most areas. Way more than we expected. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific room”
Reviews.Author: enjaydee
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was spectacular. Club Intrawest has bought floors 28, 29, and 30 of the Sheraton Wall Center and has provided floor to ceiling windows throughout for a magnificent view of Vancouver. All furnishings were quite up to date and very comfortable. Valet parking is extra but provided great convenience. Our car was ready within minutes of a call to the parking desk. My only criticism is that there is a $10 cdn fee per person for each day of use of the fitness area. This seems a bit chintzy however it may be because the Sheraton actually runs the hotel.
